articles.headline: At Least 6 White House Advisers Used Private Email Accounts
articles.snippet: While it is not necessarily illegal for White House officials to use private email accounts, President Trump had made Hillary Clinton’s mishandling of emails as secretary of state a centerpiece of his 2016 campaign.
articles.abstract: While it is not necessarily illegal for White House officials to use private email accounts, President Trump had made Hillary Clinton’s mishandling of emails as secretary of state a centerpiece of his 2016 campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At least six of President Trump’s closest advisers occasionally used private email addresses to discuss White House matters, current and former officials said on Monday.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Coming Soon to AMC Theaters: Virtual Reality Experiences
articles.snippet: The theater chain has invested $20 million in the start-up Dreamscape Immersive and will open six locations offering V.R. experiences in the next 18 months.
articles.abstract: The theater chain has invested $20 million in the start-up Dreamscape Immersive and will open six locations offering V.R. experiences in the next 18 months.
articles.lead_paragraph: CULVER CITY, Calif. — It is easily Hollywood’s hottest start-up.

articles.headline: Trying to Stem Fallout From Breach, Equifax Replaces C.E.O.
articles.snippet: After the attack, the list of possible internal candidates for the chief executive, Richard Smith, was depleted.
articles.abstract: After the attack, the list of possible internal candidates for the chief executive, Richard Smith, was depleted.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the board of Equifax convened last week to discuss the company’s response to an enormous data breach, the 10 outside directors concluded that it was time for their hard-driving chief executive to step down.
articles.byline: By Ron Lieber and Stacy Cowley
